page.title: 12Hellesdons Community Centre
page.content: The community centre was opened on Jan 10 1959 by Mr.T.Taylor,head of the secondary modern school.The caretakers wages are paid by the local council, but the manager has to raise money to pay for all the improvements which they make inside.It costs about 10,000 pounds a year to run. Many people rent out the rooms.Some of these groups are eg. playgroup,friendship club,brownies, St.Johns ambulance,horticulture,toppers ,Hellesdon players,Bowls club,Yoga,the conservatives and the Royal British Legion.Just after the war money was raised by the welcome home fund.This was the begining of the fund for the centre.Every organisation has one free room a week.After the centre was built everyone was asked to donate a chair. The centre is so heavily used that there are plans for an exstention.
